text: Such a flavorful session! Dank pine and citrus pours brown copper. Taste is sweet malt with a strong hop profule. Finished clean and crisp. Plus its available at Lambeau Field, whats not to love?

Tallboy can from Flanagans Appleton. Hazy copper, large foamy off-white head, good retention. Aroma of grainy malt, lemon, a bit of pine. The taste is pine, lemon, tea, earth, pale malt. Medium bodied, refreshing, a bit different. Nice!
This is by far the best session IPA I have had. The manage to keep the abv below 5% but still produce a robust and very hoppy IPA. This is an all-day drinking beer.
This is a refreshing brew that finishes with such a smooth finish. They sell this stuff in Lambeau so I mean, there is no competition.

Now this is what I call a session IPA! Full flavor despite coming in at a 4.8% abv. Nose of freshly cut grass mixed with citrus. bold, hoppy, citrusy taste. well balanced and not too bitter. A wonderful orange/amber hue. Complex in flavor, and just a wonderfully easy drinking IPA that wont knock you out.

I am consistently disappointed by Session IPAs however green chop is a Session that drinks above and beyond the watery trend of most. Nose on this beer is straight dank mango and some tropical notes. Malty but subtle enough to have a few. Appeasing bitterness.

Aroma of pine and citrus to start off with, pours clear amber with a full light tan head. Nice clean pine hop notes in the flavor, going to a crisp bitterness. Light bodied, and easy drinking. A nice Session IPA.

16 oz. can, consumed on 4-1-16. Dry, hops-dominated aroma features scents of caramel, bran muffin, and dry biscuit. Pleasant smell. Pours a surprisingly dark amber. Clear liquid, although there is haze in the final pour. Moderate amount of beige head. Beautiful color of both liquid and head. Mild to moderate effervescence. Long-lasting head. Good lacing. Really good looking. Earns a rare 5 for appearance from me. One of the best-looking beers Ive seen in a long time. Nice, dry, bitter flavor matches the aroma. Dry biscuit. Uni-dimensional in flavor, but thats the purpose of the style, and it works really well in that dimension. Light to medium body. Easy to drink. Smooth in the palate and adequately lively. Overall, a very good beer for the style and looks fantastic. I would describe it a s a red session IPA. A pleasant surprise.
Great session ipa! Citrusy, light bodied, crisp and clean ipa. Good hop bite! Had on tap and out of can.
draft. Clear copper with thin white head. Floral aroma with a pine and citrus taste. Medium bitterness.
473ml can. Super dank in the nose, flavor is tropical dankiness, some persimmon/guava.

clear copper with a fairly thick beige head. Aroma is a beautiful floral citrus. Resinous mouth feel. Taste is hoppy citrus. Not the best tasting IPA Ive ever had, but the aroma when taking a sip really pulls it through. I agree with arkurzynski. I lean toward it being more of a straight IPA than Session.  But that doesnt mean I dont like it.  I like it.

16oz can shared. Medo orange color with white head. Mild lacing. The aroma is a burst of grapefruit. The flavor is decent enough for a session nice hop flavor mild to medium malt base. Mild bitterness flavor.
Deep copper. Nose of citrus and caramel candy. Flavor is caramel and lemon citrus. Dank. Syrupy. Not overally sessionable, but okay.
